ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We went over different skills and insights that are helpful for leadership and team building. These included, types of leadership, followership, listening, motivation tactics, and decision making.
Important factors to consider in leadership
Info about life in the Air Force, leadership styles, ourselves, our futures.
I learned basic leadership and follwership models.
understanding the fundamentals of leadership and followership, my personality and how it would affect my leadership, and what good leaders do both privately and at work
This class was about improving skills that make a good officer such as leadership, followership, listening, and evaluating personalities.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought Col McCarthy added a lot to the class by offering his insights from his own career.
No longer taught collaterally with Military History of the West
I don't feel like I got a ton out of this class and I kindof wish there was more we could have learned. The official PowerPoints sometimes seemed like relations of the readings.

Strengths: Helpful and applicable information was taught. 

Weaknesses/areas of improvement: More classroom discussions would be beneficial to the course; the tests/quizzes were somewhat subjective with the "correct answers"; tying the lessons we were learning to real-life anecdotes would be helpful.

The course moves at a reasonable pace and the content follows an ordered, logical progression that makes learning easier. Sometimes, the content is very dry or abstract (usually because it is truncated due to time limitations) but the general principles taught are clear and applicable
The course was well taught and organized based off of the material AFROTC provides.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are in AFROTC you have to take it.
Yes, includes very important knowledge for any aspiring leader to know
I would recommend this course only to a cadet in ROTC.

Being that this class is required for ROTC cadets, not sure this is applicable, but the class is an excellent introduction to leadership principles and how to apply oneself in different leadership models
Yes -- it's required of all AFROTC cadets, and the material is interesting and helpful for life in the Air Force
